definition[0]: a national bank that does business with the government, and controls the amount of money available and the general system of banks
definition[1]: the official bank of a country, which is responsible for setting interest rates, controlling the MONEY SUPPLY, producing banknotes and making money available, and keeping the country’s supply of foreign currency and gold etc
example[0]: China’s central bank said that a further decline in interest rates is unlikely.
example[1]: Germany has no plans to sell gold from its central bank reserves.
